meanings.definition: Continuing for a period of time.
meanings.sent1: The durative rain lasted all day.
meanings.sent2: The durative movie kept us entertained for hours.
meanings.sent3: The durative wait for the bus felt like an eternity.
meanings.sent4: Her durative speech captivated the audience throughout.
meanings.sent5: The durative journey through the forest was filled with wonder.

meanings.definition: Indicating a continuous action or state.
meanings.sent1: The durative sound of the waves was soothing.
meanings.sent2: His durative singing echoed through the halls.
meanings.sent3: The durative ticking of the clock became maddening.
meanings.sent4: The durative glow of the sunset painted the sky.
meanings.sent5: The durative hum of the city never ceased.

meanings.sent1: The durative meeting ended promptly at noon.
meanings.sent2: Her durative vacation lasted two weeks.
meanings.sent4: The durative performance concluded with a grand finale.
meanings.sent5: The durative celebration continued into the night.
